intro: Gymnophragma, commonly known as the naked fruit plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its lack of bracts or stipules, giving it the name "naked fruit." The plants typically have simple, alternate leaves and produce capsules as fruits. They are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. Gymnophragma species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
